question: Impact of the internet in creating informative society is dangerous for India's rich culture. To what extent do you agree with the statement?
text: We now live in a digital age where the entire world is connected, through a tool called the internet. It is the result of the technology that is developing at a cheetah's pace. It makes us feel like the world is a smaller place, where everyone knows each other. It can be accessable on various devices, like computers, smart phones, smart watches and so on. The internet is now available at almost all parts of the world, and it connects us through the means of numerous social-networking sites. There is an ocean of information available on some of these sites. If someone wanted to know or do research on a particular topic, all they have to do is to go on to search engines like google. There are also various social media platforms that we can access through the internet, and they help us connect to the rest of the world. For example, I, who is living in India, can communicate with a person that i've never met before, that is living in Mexico. The internet provides us these platforms that have become a major part of our lives.

Now, coming to the topic of the culture present in India, we used to have one of the richest cultures among the entire world. For a geographical region, its importance lies in its culture and the traditions follwed by the people living there. For instance, Japan is still respected by almost everyone around the world, due to its culture and the respect given by their citizens to their elders. India was known for its people being friendly to the ones around them. Indians used to, majority of the time, treat their elders nicely, with patience and gratitude. Our food and clothes that we wear is also a part of our culture. Most importantly, we used to celebrate our festivals grandly and be proud of our diversity.

With the introduction of internet in our society, the phenomenon of globalisation has taken place here and it affected our culture in an extremely negative way. Due to people being able to have the opportunity to learn about others culture, they have lost the interest in their own culture. People, nowadays, enjoy the continental food, like pasta tacos and cupcakes, more than their regional and staple food. They are starting to wear clothes which are too revealing and not a part of our culture. They aren't celebrating their festivals, for example, holi and diwali, in a traditional way, instead they are going out to party and have alcoholic drinks. The females instead of wanting to put on mehendi and bindis, now want to get piercings and tattoos. Rather than listening to the music in their own language, they want to listen to the songs in english, spanish, japanese and so on. One of the main characteristics of us Indian people that we were known for, is being respectful to our elders, which we can't see in many of the Indians nowadays, children are losing patience with their parents and most of them are joining their parents in retirement houses. To put it into simple words, Indians nowadays, don't care about their culture anymore, and the major cause of this issue is the internet which has been made available in our country.

To conclude, with the introduction of internet in India, has had a major negative impact on our, then used to be, rich culture. It made people too obssesed with it as there is a ginormous amount of information that we don't know, and thus made us disrespectful and insensitive about others feelings. If this problem is not tken care of, then at some point in future, we wouldn't have our own unique culture and set of traditions.
